item.title: Layoffs in January were the highest to start a year since 2009, Challenger says
item.description: With the recent narrative centering on a no-hire, no-fire labor market, the data suggests that the layoff part of the equation could be stepping up.

item.title: China's Xi reasserts Taiwan stance in call with Trump, while U.S. president pushes trade
item.description: Beijing stressed Taiwan is the most important issue while Trump highlights the trade aspects of the bilateral relations.

item.title: January jobs report will be released on Feb. 11 after shutdown delay
item.description: The January jobs report delayed by the brief government shutdown will be released next week, the Bureau of Labor Statistics said Wednesday.

item.title: Private payrolls rose by just 22,000 in January, far short of expectations, ADP says
item.description: The U.S. labor market barely budged in January, with hiring below even muted expectations.

item.title: Trump refuses to be outdone by Europe, signing his own U.S.-India trade deal
item.description: The U.S. deal comes after global trading partners have been signing trade pacts, leaving America looking ostracized and more isolated.
